member.name: T:ZincOxide.Parser.Scanner
member.summary: Summary Canonical example of GPLEX automaton

member.name: P:ZincOxide.Parser.Scanner.Buffer
member.summary: The input buffer for this scanner.

member.name: P:ZincOxide.Parser.Scanner.yyleng
member.summary: The length of the pattern in codepoints (not the same as string-length if the pattern contains any surrogate pairs).

member.name: M:ZincOxide.Parser.Scanner.MkBuffCtx
member.summary: This method creates a buffer context record from the current buffer object, together with some scanner state values.

member.name: M:ZincOxide.Parser.Scanner.RestoreBuffCtx(ZincOxide.Parser.Scanner.BufferContext)
member.summary: This method restores the buffer value and allied scanner state from the given context record value.

member.name: M:ZincOxide.Parser.Scanner.SetSource(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create and initialize a StringBuff buffer object for this scanner

member.name: M:ZincOxide.Parser.Scanner.SetSource(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary: Create and initialize a LineBuff buffer object for this scanner

member.name: M:ZincOxide.Parser.Scanner.SetSource(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Create and initialize a StreamBuff buffer object for this scanner. StreamBuff is buffer for 8-bit byte files.

member.name: M:ZincOxide.Parser.Scanner.yyless(System.Int32)
member.param: The number of codepoints to consume

member.name: M:ZincOxide.Parser.Scanner._yytrunc(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the last "n" code points from the pattern.

member.name: T:ZincOxide.Parser.StringBuffer
member.summary: This class reads characters from a single string as required, for example, by Visual Studio language services

member.name: M:ZincOxide.Parser.BuildBuffer.Mark
member.summary: Marks a conservative lower bound for the buffer, allowing space to be reclaimed. If an application needs to call GetString at arbitrary past locations in the input stream, Mark() is not called.

member.name: M:ZincOxide.Parser.BuildBuffer.Read
member.summary: Read returns the ordinal number of the next char, or EOF (-1) for an end of stream. Note that the next code point may require *two* calls of Read().
